content:
I'm glad you liked the ideas!

Since you didn't specify the exact palette name, I'll assume you got one of the popular Urban Decay palettes available at Sephora. Here are some suggestions based on popular palettes:

**If you got the Naked Heat Palette:**

* Metallic Glam Look:
	+ Base: "Ounce" (shimmery champagne) all over the lid.
	+ Lid: "He Devil" (metallic copper) starting from the lash line and blending upwards and outwards.
	+ Crease: "Ashes" (medium, warm brown) to add depth and dimension.
	+ Outer corner: "Ember" (dark, rich brown) to define the eye.

**If you got the Naked Palette:**

* Metallic Glam Look:
	+ Base: "Foxy" (shimmery beige) all over the lid.
	+ Lid: "Buck" (metallic bronze) starting from the lash line and blending upwards and outwards.
	+ Crease: "Naked" (medium, warm brown) to add depth and dimension.
	+ Outer corner: "Blackout" (dark, cool brown) to define the eye.

**If you got the Naked Smoky Palette:**

* Metallic Glam Look:
	+ Base: "High" (shimmery champagne) all over the lid.
	+ Lid: "Radar" (metallic copper) starting from the lash line and blending upwards and outwards.
	+ Crease: "Foxy" (medium, warm brown) to add depth and dimension.
	+ Outer corner: "Blackjack" (dark, cool brown) to define the eye.

Feel free to adjust the shades based on your personal preferences and skin tone. You can always experiment with different combinations to find the perfect look for you!

Remember to blend, blend, blend, and don't be afraid to add more or less of each shade to achieve the desired effect. Have fun and enjoy playing with your new palette!
